Interview Questions: Solve a 3-variable systems of equations problem, solve a trig equation, such as sin x + cos x =1

title: Lab Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Central Florida (Orlando, FL) in Aug 2014
Interview Descriptions: Pretty easy, typical interview questions. The normal questions they always ask like strengths or weaknesses. They pretty much went through a list on a paper and take down notes on your response. It went quick and smooth. The interview was held in an office, it was dress professionally. The hiring manager is college students that are also attending classes so it wasn't to strict.
Interview Questions: What are some skills?

title: Facilities Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at University of Central Florida (Orlando, FL) in Jul 2014
Interview Descriptions: I was really in need of a job so I found a list of jobs available on campus. I called and left a message and received a phone call asking for an interview the next day.
Interview Questions: Are you able to work evenings or weekends?

title: Laboratory Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Central Florida
Interview Descriptions: It is a student position, so become a student, see if position is available, ask if you can work there, fill out application. go to an interview and then work the job.
Interview Questions: no difficult questions, just use common sense

title: Human Resources Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Central Florida
Interview Descriptions: I applied to the OPS pool for the admin positions. One general interview with the HR team that lasted about 30 minutes. I then received a call back the same day offering the position and I accepted.
Interview Questions: mostly behavioral types of questions

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Central Florida
Interview Descriptions: graduate research assistants is done while working on your thesis
Interview Questions: not any unexpected questions applying to graduate school

title: Adjunct Instructor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of Central Florida (Orlando, FL) in May 2014
Interview Descriptions: Brief. Interviewed by the college itself, then by the program coordinator. The college mainly looked at my background, while the coordinator asked more pointed questions about my teaching experience. The time between interviews was three days.
Interview Questions: About teaching philosophy

title: Graphic Designer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Central Florida (Orlando, FL) in May 2014
Interview Descriptions: First I had to apply through their website. Then I was called to come in for an interview. The interview is done by a group (current designers and directors). It was overwhelming seeing so many people, but they made me feel confortable and were really nice to me. They asked to see my portfolio and ask me to explain some of my work.
Interview Questions: What is your creative process?

title: Admissions Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Central Florida (Orlando, FL) in Apr 2014
Interview Descriptions: Everyone is friendly during the interview process here, they last maximum 45 minutes. First you submit your application on jobs with UCF. They then will complete a phone interview if you are selected. If you make it to the next round you normally then will have a panel interview of at least 3 people. Normally more around 5.
Interview Questions: All of the questions were very standard. What are your strengths, weaknesses, etc. One interesting one was have you ever had to do a repetitive task and how did you handle it.

title: Program Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of Central Florida (Orlando, FL) in Feb 2014
Interview Descriptions: The application process is long and people are interviewed by more than 2 people at a time. Be prepared to go in for more than one interview.  it's common that even after completing the two interviews the panel will debate as to who they will hire for a very extensive amount of time and might decide not to hire but to keep searching.
Interview Questions: Why should we choose you?

title: Instructor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Central Florida
Interview Descriptions: Last minute hire with expedited process felt rushed
Interview Questions: how do you navigate multiple visions for your position

title: Student Support Services Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Central Florida (Orlando, FL) in Dec 2013
Interview Descriptions: Submitted Interview through their online site. Did follow up with head of Student Support Services. She was nice and told me that the job fell under another department but asked if I had applied for another position she had open. I had applied, I suspect the HR department may be obmiting applications.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Online@UCF Support Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Central Florida (Orlando, FL)
Interview Descriptions:
I first sent my resume through the UCF career site.

It asked me to submit a personal website. I emailed the employers because this was mandatory and I did not know how to respond. They said put something funny if I did not want to share a personal website. I decided to put a cat meme.

In my interview, they asked me to jog their minds about what I submitted for the link. I reminded them that I put a cat meme. They laughed and remembered that they chose my application in part because of it.

Their questions were pretty standard:

What are your strengths, Weaknesses? etc.

Tell me about your previous relevant experience?

I had two managers that participated in my interview.
Interview Questions: Describe a time that you helped someone do something technical process.

title: Senior Fiscal Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at University of Central Florida (Orlando, FL) in Nov 2013
Interview Descriptions: First step is to apply online at jobswithucf.com, it took some time to but I was notified through e-mail for interview, after the interview was scheduled I went and completed it. It took about 2 weeks to get a response.
Interview Questions: Explain a time where you had an issue with a co-worker or manager, how did you handle it.

title: Graduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at University of Central Florida (Orlando, FL) in Oct 2013
Interview Descriptions: The professor mentioned in class and I went to his office talking about in detail. He asked what performance I have on particular aspect (e.g ability of math problem solving, how sensible to numbers and opinions on this field in the future) Then I sent him my resume and after 2 weeks I got the offer. Not sure how many students to apply.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Central Florida (Orlando, FL) in Aug 2013
Interview Descriptions: The on-line application is exceptionally extensive.  Interviewing is typical of most companies, not too bad if you are prepared answer questions about the area being applied for.
Interview Questions: I was asked to  describe myself using five words.  I have never come across this one and it threw me off balance.  A great question to as your interviewer!

title: Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at University of Central Florida (Orlando, FL) in Aug 2013
Interview Descriptions: After applying on line I was contacted for a phone interview.  The HR staff verified my phone number and set up a time that I would be called for the interview.  The interview lasted approximately 45 minutes.  After several days I received an email asking me to submit some of my work on Excel worksheets from my previous employer for review.
Interview Questions: Why would you like to work for UCF?

title: Student Caller Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Central Florida in Aug 2013
Interview Descriptions: To be a student caller for the UCF Foundation you have to email the manager who will then send you an application. After filling out the application you will be asked to do a "mock call." This mock call is a fake alumni call. During this call, just make sure you sound excited about the University and do not just read the script. This will ensure that you have a better chance of getting the job. The manager will then review applications, mock calls, and availability. You will be hired depending on those three criteria. Before applying though be aware this job is fundraising, your daily duty is to quite simply ask alumni for donations. Do not apply if you are uncomfortable with this.
Interview Questions:
What is your availability?
Do you feel comfortable asking alumni for donations?

title: Research Scientist Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 8 weeks. I interviewed at University of Central Florida
Interview Descriptions:
(1) receive an introduction of the college and university

(2) go over your resume

(2) most questions are technical related

(3) give a presentation of your research and question time after that

(4) lunch time

(5) visit the college and labs
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Central Florida
Interview Descriptions: just asked general questions regarding your knowledge of word, Excel, powerpoint program outlook ect. also wanted to know your ability to multi task as well as provide detailed information.
Interview Questions: none

title: Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Central Florida (Orlando, FL) in Jun 2013
Interview Descriptions: Long and thorough. I initially had a phone interview with the position's immediate supervisor, the department director and students that I would oversee. I was invited for an on campus interview where I presented, interviewed with a panel, met with students, had two one on one interviews, and toured the campus.
Interview Questions: Describe your leadership style

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at University of Central Florida (Daytona Beach, FL)
Interview Descriptions: Previously knew the manager so no interview was needed.
Interview Questions: None

title: Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 days. I interviewed at University of Central Florida (Orlando, FL) in May 2013
Interview Descriptions: Very relaxed interview, with just one person, once I applied they called me in about 3 days later to come in, sat down with me for about 15 minutes and the next day I knew I had the job.
Interview Questions: More questions on personality and abilities

title: Instructional Designer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at University of Central Florida (Orlando, FL)
Interview Descriptions: Application. Phone interview. Panel interview. Individual interviews. Background check. Reference check. Much of the interviewing is with future peers. You do meet and interview with the management teams - from line manager up to director and even vice president. At one point, you present an example of online course design you have delivered, and you speak about it regarding design concerns in a panel environment with future peers.
Interview Questions: What was the most difficult working situation you have had and how did you manage it? Also, scenarios where faculty members (your future clients) are very difficult and tell you they haven't had time to do their part in course prep, how do you handle them?

title: Peer Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Central Florida (Orlando, FL) in Feb 2013
Interview Descriptions: I did not really have any experience or expectations going into the interview. I was just friendly and optimistic for the opportunity. The interview lasted about 20 minutes with two other advisors in the room.
Interview Questions: An example of a stressful moment you handled

title: Assistant Interview

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Central Florida (Orlando, FL) in Aug 2012

title: Parking Patroller Interview

title: CWEP Student - Technical Senior Interview

title: Intern - Hourly Interview

title: Assistant Director Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of Central Florida (Orlando, FL) in Feb 2012

not hard, very laid back                                            
easy people to talk to.
panel

title: Graduate Teaching Assistant Interview

Interview Descriptions: The interview process involved submitting a CV, resume, transcript/relevant coursework and an application asking why the candidate wanted the position. title: CWEP Student - Technical Senior Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Central Florida (Orlando, FL) in Jun 2011
Interview Descriptions: The questions asked were mostly about my resume and what I can do and cannot as pertaining to their needs. There were not many technical questions. However it was unprofessional because they forgot that there was an interview and came in late.  This is pertaining to the on-sight interview.
Interview Questions: Not really

Interview Descriptions: Long process with multiple interviews with upper administration and staff. Skype interview Followed by on campus visit. Patience needed with state procedures.
Interview Questions: Behavioral questions. Specify actual experiences with your response. Problem-solving.

title: Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Central Florida (Orlando, FL) in Feb 2011
Interview Descriptions: Written exam first then the professor will choose students randomly by the standard of test score. Then 2 professors will talk to you, respectively, about their projects. If you are interested, you join one of them, otherwise you keep talking to more professors on your own. The first year fellowship is guaranteed, all you need to do is teaching. But find the right project can be time consuming, so no hurry in the searching but also do not waste time.
Interview Questions: What do you know about thin film physics

title: CWEP Student Interview

My interview consisted of 4 ladies asking me mainly questions regarding my previous experiences.  No technical questions were asked.  The interview lasted about 20 minutes.

Group Interview with Search Panel

1:1 interview with hiring manager

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
